1115807290504835072.text: For these reasons, a high yield is not alone a sufficient reason to acquire an asset and stake. This is obvious to people with finance backgrounds but might not be to a lot of others, so I hope people avoid using yield as a highlight of why you should acquire/stake something.

1115807288369926145.text:
The lion’s share of the value comes from the cash fees and capital gains from token sales. 

Cash flows could come from custodial fees, transaction fees, etc. 

Capital gains come from token appreciation, which fundamentally should be linked to cash flows.

1115807270900604933.text:
In the staking space, the term yield is sometimes used to highlight good opportunities, and i think this causes some confusion.

Staking yield equals the staking rewards (in tokens) divided by the stake (in tokens). It’s doesn’t indicate the return potential of staking.

1108863439378604032.text: 1/ I’ve been trying to wrap my head around Ethereum 2.0 since it’s a huge roadmap and there’s so many different materials on it. Here’s my understanding of what’s happening at a high level and some resources I found helpful. Corrections/further input welcome

1108571398996254720.text: Yup, Loop uses submarine swaps to go from Lightning to on chain (and soon vice versa). Transaction batching coming soon.™

1108547118753406976.text: future versions of the system will continue to evolve by leveraging tech like AMP to allow users to Loop In/Out several channels in a single swoop (loop!), proper scheduling and batching on the server side will ensure chain space is used as efficiently as possible maximizing xput

1108545897569222658.text:
in the other direction, with Loop In, users can: accept an on-chain payment to a p2sh address which is then immediately swapped into LN to be available as their channel balance

alternatively, they can also withdrawal freshly acquired sats from apps like @CashApp directly into LN

1108545269233115136.text: amongst many other things, Loop can be used as a way to bridge the old world (on-chain) with the new (off-chain): you can use the service to do things like deposit directly to an exchange from your channels *without* the exchange needing to be aware of LN at all

1108544505785937920.text:
similar to lnd, the loopd daemon exposes a gRPC API + REST proxy, so those familiar with driving lnd in their language of choice should feel right at home, docs can be found here: https://lightning.engineering/loop/index.html

1081742597377454080.text: I admire and understand the power of markets to improve lives and create value. But people wil not be able to outcompete AI, self-driving vehicles, robots and software for a growing range of tasks. We need to evolve or else we will witness more and more of us being cast aside.

1081740254330216448.text: We have adapted to the marketplace as much as humanly possible.  It is time for the market to adapt to us.

1081743232910966784.text: The market will not care about displaced cashiers or truckers or accountants. It just wants to get things done as efficiently as possible. Capital efficiency will value machines over humanity more and more.

1081743962271113216.text: Our best path forward is to redefine economic value around human well-being - health, mental health, freedom from substance abuse, sustainability, average quality of life, etc. - and create new markets and measurements that would actually tell us how we are doing.
